A1.question_text: To begin, I will ask you about major depressive episodes. In the last two weeks, have you been feeling sad, empty, or depressed most of the day, nearly every day?

A1a.question_text: Is this a change from your usual mood?

A2.question_text: In the last two weeks, have you been much less interested in most things or much less able to enjoy the things you used to enjoy most of the day, nearly every day?

A2a.question_text: Is this a change from your usual self?

CHECK_A1_A2.question_text: Internal Logic: Proceed if at least one of A1 or A2 is positive.

A3.question_text: During that same two-week period, did you notice a significant change in your appetite or weight, either increasing or decreasing, when you weren't trying to?

A4.question_text: In the last two weeks, have you had trouble sleeping nearly every night? This could be trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or waking up too early.

A5.question_text: In the last two weeks, have you either felt restless and keyed up, or alternatively, felt slowed down, as if you were moving through molasses, nearly every day?

A6.question_text: In the last two weeks, have you felt tired or without energy nearly every day, even for small tasks?

A7.question_text: In the last two weeks, have you been feeling worthless or excessively guilty nearly every day?

A8.question_text: During that same period, have you found it difficult to concentrate or make decisions nearly every day?

A9.question_text: Have you had recurrent thoughts of death, or have you thought about harming yourself?

A10.question_text: Now, a final few questions. Did these symptoms cause significant distress or problems in your social life, your job, or other important areas of your life?

A11.question_text: Are these symptoms better explained by the effects of a substance, like alcohol or a drug, or by another medical condition?

CHECK_DIAGNOSIS.question_text: Internal Logic: Check if symptom count is 5 or more (including at least one of A1/A2) and if A10 is Yes and A11 is No.
